text.p: Following are the main stories from Austrian newspapers on Monday.
- Union OeGB remains obstinate and demands more state money for pensions. OeGB wants the state's contribution to be raised by a third before other measures are undertaken.
- The association of savings banks plans to turn holding companies without owners into foundations.
- Bankruptcy funds strive to dismantle mountain of debt.
- Austrian Railways and Verbund are currently having their widespread cable network valued by Lehman Brothers to help tele.ring look for a strategic partner at the end of September.
- Mobilkom and max.mobil are checking charges against the third GSM licence awarded to Connect Austria.

- Connect Austria, owner of the country's third mobile phone licence, plans to invest more than 10 billion schillings in the expansion of its network. Connect is aiming for a 30 percent market stake by the year 2000.
